response.2: In 2015, the percentage of cases in Spain where multiple restorations were placed in a single appointment was 14.2%, while in Germany it was 26.1%. Germany had the highest rate among the countries examined.
response.3: By 2024, France maintains a consistently high level of perceived usefulness of intraoral scanners, particularly in optimization and clinical effectiveness, while Italy shows improvement but remains lower in perceived utility compared to France. Overall, the increase in mean vote for the adoption of intraoral scanners suggests a stronger and more sustained favorability in France than in Italy.
response.4: In 2021, the percentage of intraoral scanners purchased in Italy was 12%, while in the UK it was 8%. Therefore, Italy had a higher percentage of intraoral scanner purchases compared to the UK in that year.
response.5: In 2021, 13% of intraoral scanners were purchased in Germany, while 11% were purchased in Spain.
response.6: The percentage of surgery owners aged "55 or more" is 29% in both the UK and France. Therefore, there is no percentage difference in this age group between the UK and France in 2023.
response.7: In 2023, the percentage of "more than 110" patients is 22% in Germany and 60% in Italy. Italy has a considerably higher percentage of "more than 110" patients compared to Germany.
